properties.entry: The mipmap description for level {0} specifies that the mipmap data should be {1} octets uncompressed, but the actual data was {2} octets.
The Z size of a 2D image must equal 1, but was {0}.
Mip levels must be strictly decreasing with all values present in the range [0 … {0}].
The mipmap description for level {0} specifies a CRC32 value of 0x{1} but the actual data had a CRC32 of 0x{2}.
The mipmap description for layer {0}, level {1} specifies that the mipmap data should be {2} octets uncompressed, but the actual data was {3} octets.
Mip levels must be strictly decreasing with all values present in the range [0 … {0}].
Mip layers (for level {0}) must be strictly increasing with all values present in the range [0 … {1}] (received {2}).
The mipmap description for layer {0}, level {1} specifies a CRC32 value of 0x{2} but the actual data had a CRC32 of 0x{3}.
Mip layer {0}, layer {1} is not unique.
The texture file specifies a Z size of {0} but provides {1} layers.
Texture files must contain exactly one of any of the various image data sections.
The first section in a texture should be an image information section.
